summary: The bill, titled the Protecting American Agriculture from Foreign Adversaries Act of 2025, amends the Defense Production Act of 1950. It mandates the inclusion of the Secretary of Agriculture on the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) for transactions involving agricultural land, biotechnology, and related industries.  It also establishes procedures for CFIUS to review reportable agricultural land transactions involving foreign persons from specified countries (China, North Korea, Russia, and Iran), with these reviews ceasing when the country is removed from the listed adversaries.
